metadata.title: CVE-2014-0488 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
APT before 1.0.9 does not "invalidate repository data" when moving from anunauthenticated to authenticated state, which allows remote attackers tohave unspecified impact via crafted repository data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
apt-transport-https - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
apt-utils - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
libapt-inst1.5 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
libapt-pkg4.12 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1ubuntu2.3').
